utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I just wanted to start with what brings you here today to the family clinic?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, this morning I read after I woke up by I coughed up some phlegm and there was some blood in it and it it totally scared me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and was this the first time that happened?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, yeah, I've never I never noticed blood in my sputum before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, but have you been coughing recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I have, uh, had a cough recently leading up to this.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how long have you had the cough for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I've had it for uhm, yeah, about about four weeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Wow, four weeks. OK. Do you know if you did anything prior to that, any new exposures or being around someone ill like anything like that that might have caused your cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I was just down in a, I went to Haiti on a on a trip for a, for a volunteer program with my school and I don't know I definitely notice there is a lot of people down there coughing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and were you at all living like close quarters or were you crammed into like like smaller spaces at all when you were there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, we were kind of like living with the locals while we while we were there. It was part of the experience for volunteering. I was there for almost two months as part of, part of my my summer break through University.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and did you notice, uh, at all any potential exposures to tuberculosis? Anyone there that had tuberculosis? Or found out later?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, there were definitely some people around that I heard of who who mentioned tuberculosis, but I don't know if anybody specifically who had it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And the cough that you've been having for the last four weeks at, is it like a wet cough? Are you producing any sputum or phlegm, or is it more of a dry cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I have been producing some phlegm, um, but it's been just kind of white, yellowish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Up until this morning?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah or moreso clear actually, up until today where I saw some blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how much blood was in the phlegm? Was it like a significant amount it filled the whole production or just little streaks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um it was pretty red. It, ah, yeah it was bright red and it was covering the, the issue.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and have you had any similar episodes before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've never brought up blood before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And after this morning, was that the only time you had that or did you did it recur at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it was just that time just this morning on the tissue and then a little bit in the toilet and it looked like a lot in the in the water.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see and how often are you coughing in like an average day? Are you coughing throughout the day or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, it's been pretty severe through throughout the day. I've been just coughing or coughing a ton.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anything that makes your coughing go away or makes it worse at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not-nothing seems to help. I've tried various over the counter medications and and stuff for, for cough and nothing has seemed to help it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you having any other symptoms at all, like shortness of breath, sore throat, runny nose, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, nothing like like that. I mean the back of my throat, might feel a little itchy from the coughing, but not really sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you having any headaches or nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like, well, a little bit of nausea maybe, but no vomiting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How often you getting nausea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it's coming after like if I'm having a really big cough, coughing fit I could feel a little nauseous after but it doesn't last very long.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you having any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been having ah, so fevers throughout the day, but feeling really hot, and and really sweaty at night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how often are you getting night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, also a few times this past week, I've what woke up soaked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you at all measured when you felt, measured your temperature when you felt like these chills and night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't measured my temperature yet.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you noticed at all, uh, any increased fatigue throughout the day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, but I've definitely been more more tired. I haven't been able to concentrate on, umm, on my schoolwork.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, um, have you been having any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just after the, like coughing really, but otherwise, ah, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any feeling that your heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any swelling in your limbs at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok. Any loss of sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your urination?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes at all in your sleep?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, just been, well, I haven't been sleeping as well, waking up all sweaty and the cough is kept me up a little bit too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I've been eating OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you noticed at all any weight loss over the last few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think I'm down like 15 pounds since the summer time, which is great.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried to lose weight at all or is it just been completely unintentional?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, well I, I mean my, my appendix was taken out a few months ago and so I guess after that I, well, maybe wasn't eating and eating as much, but I mean I wasn't really trying to lose weight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any recent exposure to any fumes or dust or animals?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, my my parents have a dog at home, but I've been away at school, so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, uh, in terms of your overall health, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I'm uh, healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So like no asthma or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you on any medications currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. Yeah, I take an oral contraceptive pill.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um, and when did you start that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably about five years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any allergies, to any medications or any environmental allergies at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, I think Septra, gives me a rash.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, any previous hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never been in the hospital before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any previous surgery? So you said you had the appendix removed but anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no the appendix was the only thing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any family history of asthma or any lung conditions? Any cancers that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah but well, my grandfather had lung cancer, but he smoked for his entire life. And my mom has had diabetes for quite some time, but no, no lung problems.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any heart attacks in the family or any autoimmune conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and currently what is your living situation like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I live with uh, four roommates here going to school.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so do you work right now or you just a student right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just a student.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And currently do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I'mm smoke maybe maybe socially so, maybe a pack of cigarettes a week at the at the most.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any recreational drug use like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah I'll smoke one or two joints on on the weekend with friends socially.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, so yeah. This uh, the smoking marijuana or cigarettes make your symptoms worse at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, it depends. Yeah, sometimes I can. It can bring on some more coughing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so yeah, we always recommend cutting down or quitting smoking whenever, whenever we see patients who are smoking, especially like, you're fairly young. And you know your grandfather had history of lung cancer with smoking throughout the year. So as early as we can quit smoking, the better for the long term health of your lungs, but whenever you're thinking of quitting, or if you want any more resources about quitting, just let me know. We can set up a separate appointment for that.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, that that sounds good. Yeah, maybe maybe next appointment we can talk about that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds good. Um. Any, uh, so no recreational, so just besides marijuana. Any other recreational drugs like cocaine or crystal meth, anything of that sort?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, no. Well, sometimes I at parties maybe a few times a year with friends will use ecstasy or something like that, but that's only a few times a year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, and any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'll have a few drinks on the weekend with with friends usually. Like rum or beer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Yeah, so this is all the questions I had for you today. Any, any questions or concerns or any ideas of what you think this might be?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I don't know. I'm really concerned about the the blood that I brought up like I mean is this cancer or, uh, uh tuberculosis like one of those tuberculosis infections that I heard about while I was away?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so definitely, a cancer is pretty unlikely because you're fairly young and you've just recently started smoking, but one of the things that we're concerned about is your recent travel history being in close quarters. So definitely we need to get a chest X-Ray and we can even do a sputum culture to test for tuberculosis. And then based on the results, we might have to start you on like a whole antibiotic regiment if it does come back as tuberculosis. Yeah, we'll, we'll, we'll get those investigations done first and then we'll go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: We'll also get some blood work done as well, so that'll be done before your next appointment.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, that sounds good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
